      SAAccess(java.lang.String host, java.lang.String port, boolean ssl, boolean selfSigned, java.lang.String realm, java.lang.String applicationID, java.lang.String applicationKey)
      Returns a SAAccess Object that can be used to query the SecureAuth Rest API This should be the default object used when setting up connectivity to the SecureAuth Appliance

    • Constructor Detail

      • SAAccess

        public SAAccess(java.lang.String host,
                java.lang.String port,
                boolean ssl,
                java.lang.String realm,
                java.lang.String applicationID,
                java.lang.String applicationKey)

        Returns a SAAccess Object that can be used to query the SecureAuth Rest API This should be the default object used when setting up connectivity to the SecureAuth Appliance

        Parameters:
        host - FQDN of the SecureAuth Appliance
        port - The port used to access the web application on the Appliance.
        ssl - Use SSL
        realm - the Configured Realm that enables the RESTApi
        applicationID - The Application ID from the Configured Realm
        applicationKey - The Application Key from the Configured Realm

      • SAAccess

        public SAAccess(java.lang.String host,
                java.lang.String port,
                boolean ssl,
                boolean selfSigned,
                java.lang.String realm,
                java.lang.String applicationID,
                java.lang.String applicationKey)

        Returns a SAAccess Object that can be used to query the SecureAuth Rest API This should be the default object used when setting up connectivity to the SecureAuth Appliance

        Parameters:
        host - FQDN of the SecureAuth Appliance
        port - The port used to access the web application on the Appliance.
        ssl - Use SSL
        selfSigned - Support for SeflSigned Certificates. Setting to enable disable self signed cert support
        realm - the Configured Realm that enables the RESTApi
        applicationID - The Application ID from the Configured Realm
        applicationKey - The Application Key from the Configured Realm

        Confirm the DFP data from Client using the Rest API

      • DFPValidateNewFingerprint

        public DFPValidateResponse DFPValidateNewFingerprint(java.lang.String userid,
                                                     java.lang.String host_address,
                                                     java.lang.String jsonString,
                                                     java.lang.String accept,
                                                     java.lang.String accept_charset,
                                                     java.lang.String accept_encoding,
                                                     java.lang.String accept_language)

        Validate the DFP data from Client using the Rest API

        Parameters:
        userid - The User ID that you want to validate from
        host_address - The ID of the finger print to check against the data store
        jsonString - The JSON String provided by the Java Script
        accept - Accept Value provided by the application to buidl the Digital Finger Print
        accept_charset - The accept Charset supplied by the client from the application server
        accept_encoding - The accept Encoding supplied by the client from the application server
        accept_language - The accepted language by the client supplied by the application server
        Returns:
        DFPValidateResponse
